content: Hey everyone. ...we had to sleep in the car, on the street last night :oh_no: ...there was a 6.3 one yesterday, followed by 11 aftershocks of magnitude 4-5 throughout the day and night ...experts are saying that "the phenomenon is still in progress" :grimacing:
...no casualties so far :pray: :fingers_crossed:
Glad you and yours are ok!

Oh, I can relate to this as I was in Istanbul when https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1999_%C4%B0zmit_earthquake happened, so I've experienced in person what you are going through now. Unfortunately, Mediterranean region at whole is quite seismically active. Stay safe, Greg!

1999 Ä°zmit earthquake
On 17 August 1999, an earthquake in northwestern Turkey killed around 17,000 people[5] and left more than 250,000 people homeless. The shock had a moment magnitude of 7.6 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of IX (Violent). The event lasted for 37 seconds, severely damaging the city of Ä°zmit.
Sorry to hear that. Does not sound like fun. Take care of yourself.

@klonos - Any quick updates from you? Is everyone ok?
Has the earth quieted down?
Unfortunately no @StPaulTim ...we had another 5.9 magnitude last night at 8:40pm, followed by many 3+ and 4+ ones ...then a 5.1 around 9:20pm, also followed by many smaller ones :oh_no:
...my colleagues in New Zealand had a 7.1 and a 7.3 + tsunami warnings issued :open_mouth:
...the entire globe seems to be going crazy ATM.

https://www.volcanodiscovery.com/earthquakes/greece-today.html

Earthquakes in or near Greece today: latest quakes past 24 hours, Friday, 5 Mar 2021 - complete list and interactive map
Look up most recent and past earthquakes in or near Greece. File an "I felt it" report if you were in the area and felt one! Frequently updated list and interactive map, updates, links and background info.
Screen-Shot-2021-03-05-at-3.16.13-am.png
^^ that's where I live ...and that's only the 4+ magnitude quakes over the last 2 days
Augh, sorry to hear it, @klonos! May the earth calm down (despite all we've done to piss it off) and may you and yours stay safe.
Thanks @Jack :heart: :fingers_crossed: :pray:
...fortunately no casualties so far. ...the entirety of the Greek peninsula is on an earthquake zone ...it's basically where the African tectonic plate meets the Eurasian one: image.png
...so all modern homes/buildings are built with an anti-earthquake structure, which I think is meant to withstand 6+ magnitude.
...but people with old homes in various villages around the area saw their properties tumble to the ground :disappointed:
Just had another quake as I was typing all that ...waiting for the magnitude to be announced.
I've never experienced an earthquake. Be well, take care, stay safe.

StPaulTim said:

I've never experienced an earthquake. Be well, take care, stay safe.

Lucky you are. And never do! It's indeed terrible experience.

They are not scary to me, rather than annoying ...especially now that it seems that these tremors are going to be an ongoing thing for at least a couple of weeks (I'm prone to motion sickness, so feeling ðŸ¤® all day is not fun) ...being ataraxic and all, the pragmatic portion of my brain is just triggered and I try to find solutions (planning escape routes, thinking of all possible scenarios, trying to keep my family safe etc.) ...similarly with having to sleep out in the car with nights still being cold here: instead of discomfort, my OCDs get triggered because I'm getting out of my routine, so not enjoying it at all.
...some context on the above: everyone in the area feels dizzy and has migraines because of all the small 2-3 magnitude quakes that happen as often as every 10-20min.
Things any better yet? @klonos
Better as in only two 4+ magnitude quakes in the last 24hrs - no 5+ or 6+, but many 2+ and 3+ a few km NW of my hometown: image.png
...so we're still shaking

...I am also checking neighbouring Italy and Turkey, and there's the same pattern of quakes across the ridge where the African plate and the Eurasian plate meet. ...so we're OK for now, but everyone's afraid of more big ones.
YouTube - Jerry Lee Lewis - Whole Lotta Shakin' Going On (From "Legends of Rock 'n' Roll" DVD)
:laughing:
...lucky that the entirety of Australia is in the middle of their tectonic plate ...means they hardly ever get any quakes ...but then you have the bushfires to worry about :shrug:
Yeah, I've never experienced an earthquake. Coffs Harbour gets flooding more than anything. So flooding and bushfires. Unfortunately not at the same time :blush:

Yeah. I've heard that depending on the morphology of the terrain, these alternate ...each time you have fires, the trees that hold the soil with their roots are gone; so next time the rains come, there are floods and landslides.

...for those that don't follow world news, the volcano of Etna in Italy was activated multiple times over the past two weeks, and there was this odd drainage of waters in Venice (Italy is also on the same African/Eurasian tectonic plate ridge).

https://apnews.com/article/mount-etna-volcano-eruption-explained-a24ce517eaba73dbac3fa30b9cf7e903

Explainer: Mount Etna puts on its latest spectacular show
ROME (AP) â€” Mount Etna, the volcano that towers over eastern Sicily, evokes superlatives. It is Europeâ€™s most active volcano and also the continentâ€™s largest. And the fiery, noisy show of...

https://www.businessinsider.com/low-tides-leave-venices-canals-dry-months-after-heavy-flooding-2021-2

Venice's world-famous 'streets of water' left dry after dramatic low tides drained its canals
The Mayor of Venice, Luigi Brugnaro, maintains that the rapidly alternating water levels are linked to climate change.
